newsitem.title: USA: U.S., CHINA SET TELECOMMUNICATIONS CONFERENCE.
newsitem.headline: U.S., CHINA SET TELECOMMUNICATIONS CONFERENCE.

text.p: Representatives from about 20 telecommunications and information technology firms will participate in a U.S.-China conference to promote business opportunities in China, U.S. Commerce Department officials said Wednesday.
The China America Telecommunications Summit will be held in Dalian, eastern China, Oct. 8-10, for U.S. companies interested in doing business in China's rapidly growing telecommunications market.

Assistant Secretary of Commerce Larry Irving said it was the first time that China will be hosting such a conference and that it would provide an opportunity for both sides to get an understanding of each other's needs.
"I would charactierize this as discussions, not negotiations," Irving told a group of business representatives at a Commerce Department briefing on the conference.

U.S. business and government officials will be able to discuss a number of issues with Chinese central government and provincial government officials who will be participating in the two-day conference, he said. U.S. Commerce Secretary William Daley, who will be in China to attend a meeting of the U.S.-China Joint Commission on Commerce and Trade, will also participate in the telecommunications conference.
The U.S. Telecommunications Industry Association said China's tecommunications market was worth about $10 billion this year and growing by about 40 percent annually.
